meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>groom</kanji> gets a <kanji>flower</kanji> on his lapel and he's finally a real <vocabulary>bridegroom</vocabulary>! Before that he was just waiting to be one. The flower makes it for real.
readingMnemonic: The readings for this word are both kun'yomi readings. You learned them when you learned the kanji, so you should be able to read this on your own.
